conclusion: A pedestrian runs at a constant speed to catch up with a bus that has stopped due to a red light.
When the pedestrian reaches a point 36 meters away from the bus, the green light turns on, and the bus starts moving forward with uniform acceleration.
The v-t graph shows the pedestrian's speed is constant at 8 m/s.
The v-t graph shows the bus's speed increases linearly from 0 m/s.
At the point where the pedestrian is 36 meters away from the bus, the bus's speed is also 8 m/s.
Since the bus's speed continues to increase while the pedestrian's speed remains constant, the pedestrian will not be able to catch up with the bus.
